content: NB: I just bruteforced this in a way that wouldn't have worked with much larger numbers... Use that information how you wish...

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: short puzzle, ideal for fast

great puzzle!

may be a bit too much text:
-shorten your exemple
-add space between section
-separate the story of the main question

in output change "tray" for "square tray"

good job :)

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Nice. Very simple problem that takes a bit of thinking about dimensions/geometry to solve. (Took c. 1.5min to understand the statement and 2min to complete from there.)

(One of my first comments so could be missing the point.)

I think you are assuming that pizzas can only be placed in horizontal and vertical grid. For example, you say that "If John needs to carry 2 pizzas of the same size [radius 8], he would need a 32x32 tray." However, the pizzas fit on an approximately 27.3 x 27.3 tray if placed diagonally from one another. (You can calculate this exactly with Pythagoras' theorem or just try drawing the diagram and measuring it.)

You could fix this by changing the pizzas to be square (such as changing the story to be about boxes or just saying that the pizzas have to be arranged in a grid for some reason).

(If you stick to the question as-is, allowing non-grid placements, the calculations get way more complex for the bigger numbers of pizzas so it would seem better as a hard classic puzzle or something.)
Great suggestions ! Changed problem statement to pizza boxes instead.
Thank you for the information. This is my first contribution. Can I still add another test case or is it too late now?
You should still be able to edit it, as far as I know!
Added another test case for big numbers.

One of the properties of pizza boxes is that they can be stacked vertically. This would break the problem; I think you should explicity state that this isn't allowed.

You also have a constraint "0 <= r <= 1000000000", but "r" is not mentioned anywhere else in the problem.
Thank you for your feedbacks! Added a statement to prevent stacking and changed "r" to "b".
